item.title: Aspora gets $50M from Sequoia to build remittance and banking solutions for Indian diaspora
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: India has been one of the top recipients of remittances in the world for more than a decade. Inward remittances jumped from $55.6 billion in 2010-11 to $118.7 billion in 2023-24, according to data from the country’s central bank. The bank projects that figure will reach $160 billion in 2029. This means there is an […]

item.title: The U.S. Navy is more aggressively telling startups, ‘We want you’
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: While Silicon Valley executives like those from Palantir, Meta, and OpenAI are grabbing headlines for trading their Brunello Cucinelli vests for Army Reserve uniforms, a quieter transformation has been underway in the U.S. Navy. How so? Well, the Navy’s chief technology officer, Justin Fanelli, says he has spent the last two and a half years […]

item.title: Spiraling with ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: ChatGPT seems to have pushed some users towards delusional or conspiratorial thinking, according to a recent feature in The New York Times.

item.title: Taiwan places export controls on Huawei and SMIC
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Chinese companies Huawei and SMIC may have a difficult time accessing resources needed to build AI chips, due to Taiwanese export controls.

item.title: Alexa von Tobel has high hopes for ‘fintech 3.0’
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: It’s been 10 years since Alexa von Tobel sold her financial planning startup LearnVest to Northwestern Mutual for a reported $375 million. Since then, von Tobel became Northwestern Mutual’s first chief digital officer, then chief innovation officer, before launching an early-stage venture firm of her own, Inspired Capital, with former U.S. Secretary of Commerce Penny […]

item.title: Google reportedly plans to cut ties with Scale AI
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Meta’s massive investment in Scale AI may be giving some of the startup’s biggest customers pause. Reuters reports that Google had planned to pay Scale AI $200 million this year but is now planning to cut ties with the startup and is having conversations with its competitors.

item.title: How to delete your 23andMe data
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: 23andMe holds millions of customers' genetic information. Here's what you can do to protect your data.

item.title: Waymo limits service ahead of today’s ‘No Kings’ protests
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Alphabet-owned robotaxi company Waymo is limiting service due to Saturday’s scheduled nationwide “No Kings” protests against President Donald Trump and his policies.

item.title: Week in Review: WWDC 2025 recap
item.dc:creator: Karyne Levy
item.description: Welcome back to Week in Review! We have lots for you this week, including what came out of WWDC 2025; The Browser Company's AI browser; OpenAI's partnership with Mattel; and your iPad might finally be a true work machine.

item.title: The App Store’s new AI-generated tags are live in the beta
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Apple’s plans to improve App Store discoverability using AI tagging techniques are now available in the developer beta build of iOS 26. However, the tags do not appear on the public App Store as of yet, nor are they informing the App Store Search algorithm on the public store. Of course, with any upcoming App […]

item.title: Anne Wojcicki’s nonprofit reaches deal to acquire 23andMe
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Beleaguered genetic testing company 23andMe announced Friday that it has reached an agreement to sell itself to TTAM Research Institute, a nonprofit led by the company's co-founder and former CEO Anne Wojcicki.

item.title: New York passes a bill to prevent AI-fueled disasters
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: New York has a new AI safety bill that tries to regulate frontier AI models from OpenAI, Google, and Anthropic.

item.title: Clay secures a new round at a $3B valuation, sources say
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The sales automation startup doubles its valuation a month after launching a tender offer at $1.5 billion.

item.title: New details emerge on Meta’s $14.3B deal for Scale
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Meta’s deal to sort-of but not really acquire AI startup Scale, giving it 49% ownership, is certainly unusual.

item.title: TechCrunch Mobility: The cost of Waymo
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility — your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation.

item.title: Google tests Audio Overviews for Search queries
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Google Search is testing Audio Overviews for certain search queries, the company announced on Friday.

item.title: Apple’s Liquid Glass design is paving the way for AR glasses
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: This visual overhaul gives us a glimpse into the design of Apple's rumored AR glasses, which will reportedly debut next year.

item.title: Silicon Valley tech execs are joining the US Army Reserve
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: CTOs from companies including OpenAI, Meta, and Palantir make up this first cohort of CTOs in the Army Reserve.

item.title: Amazon joins the big nuclear party, buying 1.92 GW for AWS
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Amazon and Talen revised an existing deal to buy power from the Susquehanna nuclear power plant.

item.title: Startups Weekly: No sign of pause
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: This week brought us many reminders that no startup journey is linear — but the next billion-dollar idea may only be one click away.
